examples: The proud uncle held his newborn nephew in his arms.
The medicine cabinet in the bathroom holds our first aid supplies.
Hold your fire!
A strawberry margarita, but hold the tequila.
The senator held the floor for several hours.
words.defineEn: to have in one's hands or arms
words.defineVi: có trong tay hoặc cánh tay của một người

examples: Identifying a specific segment of the market as our target will be more effective than a shotgun approach.
After decades as an investigator, I can identify a con man a mile away.
Work is in hand on identifying information needs.
The doctor put his hands on me identify if the tumor had grown.
We advise a food sensitivity test to better identify true food intolerances and appropriate amount of time to keep out of your system for optimal health and healing.
words.defineEn: to be able to say who or what someone or something is
words.defineVi: để có thể nói ai hoặc cái gì một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó là

examples: Any investment involves an element of risk.
His confession involved a number of other politicians in the affair.
What will the job involve?
These changes will involve everyone on the staff.
Parents should involve themselves in their child's education.
words.defineEn: to be part of an event, situation, or activity
words.defineVi: là một phần của một sự kiện, tình hình, hoặc hoạt động

examples: Her jokes had us all in stitches.
At the charity event, the wealthy businessman's joke had everyone in stitches.
My friends all joked that I had a hollow leg.
You must be joking!’
He didn't see the joke.
words.defineEn: to say something funny or behave in a way that makes people laugh
words.defineVi: nói điều gì đó buồn cười hoặc cư xử theo cách khiến mọi người cười

examples: The closing of the airport knocked our holiday plans on the head.
The fall knocked the wind out of me.
But, it'll knock the breath out of them for a while.
The athlete's record-breaking performance in the championship game knocked his opponents out of the park, securing his place in history and earning him widespread admiration and respect.
It's nearly done - another couple of hours should knock it on the head.
words.defineEn: to hit a door, surface, etc. in a way to attract attention, especially expecting it to be opened
words.defineVi: đập vào cửa, bề mặt, v.v. theo cách để thu hút sự chú ý, đặc biệt là mong nó được mở ra

examples: The receptionist led the way to the boardroom.
The department led the world in cancer research.
The company's new product launch led to a fat increase in revenue.
We lead a very quiet life.
To lead a life of luxury/a miserable existence.
words.defineEn: to go in front of or beside someone or something in order to show them the way or to make them go in a particular direction
words.defineVi: đi trước hoặc bên cạnh ai đó hoặc cái gì đó để chỉ đường cho họ hoặc khiến họ đi theo một hướng cụ thể

examples: She carefully lifted the ginger tuber from the soil.
Her article lifts the lid on bullying in the workplace.
Students with disabilities have priority access to the lift.
The shows lifted my spirits and reminded me that this nightmare would soon be over.
He bent his back to lift the heavy box.
words.defineEn: to move a thing from a lower position or level to a higher one
words.defineVi: để di chuyển một điều từ một vị trí thấp hơn hoặc mức cao hơn

examples: The car ahead of me jumped the light.
The lights changed to green.
Sometimes darkness can show you the light.
A major technological advancement like that is still light years away.
This software first saw the light of day back in 1993.
words.defineEn: to set something on fire
words.defineVi: để đốt cháy một cái gì đó

examples: Just click the link below.
Follow the links to sign up for the webinar.
The success of a business is only as great as the least successful department within it, as a chain is only as strong as its weakest link.
Trans fatty acids have been linked to various health issues, such as an increased risk of heart disease and inflammation.
Studies show a link between cancer and processed meats.
words.defineEn: to be connected or put together in some way
words.defineVi: được kết nối hoặc kết hợp với nhau theo một cách nào đó

examples: Drug companies are locking horns in a legal battle over patents.
He locked the door before leaving the house.
I turned the key in the lock.
He turned the key in the lock.
He entered the key into the lock and opened the door.
words.defineEn: to secure something with a lock or seal
words.defineVi: để bảo đảm một cái gì đó với một khóa hoặc con dấu

examples: Mark my words.
We mark important passages in a book with a pencil underline.
The classroom ruler is marked in both inches and centimeters for easy measurement.
We should mark the date on the calendar for our family gathering.
Years of war have left their mark on these pretty islands.
words.defineEn: to leave a sign, line, etc. on something
words.defineVi: để lại một dấu hiệu, dòng, vv trên một cái gì đó

examples: The chairman's resignation finally brought matters to a head.
I gave the matter a lot of thought.
What's the matter with Matt?
Art is very much a matter of taste.
Local people took matters into their own hands and hired their own security guards.
words.defineEn: to be important or have a great effect on someone or something
words.defineVi: quan trọng hoặc có ảnh hưởng lớn đến ai đó hoặc cái gì đó

examples: Mentioning her new boyfriend just rubbed salt into the wound.
By mentioning rope in the house of a man who has been hanged?
When the old girl finally kicked the bucket there was no mention of yours truly in the will.
You struck a raw nerve when you mentioned divorce.
She could not bring herself to mention it.
words.defineEn: to say something about someone or something, without giving much detail
words.defineVi: để nói điều gì đó về ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó, mà không đưa ra nhiều chi tiết

examples: Mind your own business!
You mind the cattle, Herb.
Mind if I take a rain check on that drink?
Travel broadens the mind.
My mind went totally blank.
words.defineEn: (often used in negative or question form) to be upset, annoyed or worried by something or someone
words.defineVi: (thường dùng ở thể phủ định hoặc nghi vấn) bực bội, khó chịu hoặc lo lắng vì điều gì hoặc ai đó

examples: His number's up this time.
The report includes a number of recommendations.
His confession involved a number of other politicians in the affair.
Thirteen is a prime number.
I had a brush with him a number of years ago.
words.defineEn: to give numbers to different parts of a list or series of objects or people
words.defineVi: để cung cấp số cho các phần khác nhau của một danh sách hoặc loạt các đối tượng hoặc người

examples: She organized shampoo and soap bottles in the shower caddy in the bathroom.
We organized a tea party for our dolls with tiny cups and saucers.
Jane is organized.
They organize community events in town to bring people together.
To enhance our learning experience, our teacher organized a field trip to the museum.
words.defineEn: to make the necessary arrangements for an event or activity to take place
words.defineVi: để thực hiện các sắp xếp cần thiết cho một sự kiện hoặc hoạt động diễn ra

examples: The rich family owned a private jet.
The rich businessman owned multiple luxurious cars.
Mind your own business!
Water will always find its own level.
Many families own plots of land to grow food.
words.defineEn: to have something as for ourselves
words.defineVi: để có một cái gì đó như cho chính mình

examples: Commuters packed like sardines on the evening train.
I packed an extra jacket for the camping trip.
My sister packed some Spanish limes in her picnic basket for a tangy snack on our outdoor adventure.
We packed sandwiches for our picnic in the park.
She packed a small bag of peanuts for her road trip.
words.defineEn: to put clothes and other things needed for travel into a bag, suitcase, etc.
words.defineVi: để quần áo và những thứ khác cần thiết cho chuyến du lịch vào túi xách, vali, v.v.

examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.
The photographs clearly show a broken window.
She had old photographs of her parents displayed on the wall.
When I saw the old photograph, memories of my childhood home and the sounds of my mother's laughter sprang into my mind.
The test will involve answering questions about a photograph.
words.defineEn: to use a camera to take a picture of something
words.defineVi: để sử dụng một máy ảnh để chụp ảnh của một cái gì đó

examples: They couldn't predict the disastrous war looming a few years down the road.
The weather forecast predicted a cloudy morning followed by clearing in the afternoon.
If you pay close attention to people's behavior and actions, you can often predict their intentions, as a straw will show which way the wind blows.
It's difficult to predict what will happen, but we need to trust that the process will take its course.
The outcome, as anybody could have predicted, has been much less bang for the bucks.
words.defineEn: to say that something is going to happen before it actually takes place
words.defineVi: để nói rằng một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra trước khi nó thực sự diễn ra

examples: The lawyer presented the right argument in court.
Bring Helen a present.
Bring a present for Helen.
He presented a false document as evidence in the court case.
Our hosts presented us with an embarrassment of riches.
words.defineEn: to give something to someone as a gift
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho một cái gì đó cho một ai đó như một món quà

examples: Regular exercise and healthy eating habits can prevent many illnesses as prevention is better than cure.
The bathroom rug absorbs water and prevents slipping on the floor.
The baker dusted the work surface with flour to prevent the dough from sticking.
The cook lards the pan with pork fat to prevent the food from sticking.
The food packaging film had a color retention agent to prevent discoloration and maintain the attractive appearance of it.
words.defineEn: to stop someone from doing something; to not let something happen
words.defineVi: để ngăn ai đó làm điều gì đó; để không để cho một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: The document was printed at the taxpayer's expense.
The phone number for customer service is printed on the back of the product.
The story ran on page 4 of the print edition of the newspaper.
The printer is in full working order and is printing documents with high quality.
The newspaper has been under siege lately by its readers for printing a false story.
words.defineEn: to produce writings, pictures, etc. on a piece of paper using ink and a special device called printer
words.defineVi: để tạo ra các bài viết, hình ảnh, v.v. trên một tờ giấy bằng cách sử dụng mực và một thiết bị đặc biệt gọi là máy in

examples: This broken promise is a real kick in the teeth for our fans.
The committee members promised to put the fund behind a development scheme for the impoverished area.
My boss promised the moon, but never gave me a raise.
Promise you won't tell.
I promised my husband that I would grill some zucchini alongside the steaks.
words.defineEn: to tell someone that something will certainly happen or that we will certainly do something
words.defineVi: để nói với ai đó rằng điều gì đó chắc chắn sẽ xảy ra hoặc chúng tôi chắc chắn sẽ làm điều gì đó

examples: The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
The team finished the race in first place.
My people have a horse in this race, too.
In the Midlands the race remains too close to call.
You lost the race faster than you can say Jack Robinson.
words.defineEn: to compete with someone to see who is the fastest; to take part in a race
words.defineVi: để cạnh tranh với ai đó để xem ai là người nhanh nhất; tham gia vào một cuộc đua

examples: The door clicked shut behind me.
She went into her room and shut the door behind her.
When it comes to gossip, I've learned that a shut mouth catches no flies.
A door must be either shut or open.
That’s really shutting the stable door after the horse has bolted.
words.defineEn: to close something
words.defineVi: để đóng một cái gì đó

examples: The boat captain guided us through the narrow canals of the city.
The traveler paid a guide to show him across.
The GPS will guide you to your desired destination with turn-by-turn directions.
Morin's book is a helpful guide to surviving the first few months in harness.
They hired a violin teacher to guide them in their learning.
words.defineEn: to show the correct way or place to someone
words.defineVi: để hiển thị đúng cách hoặc địa điểm cho một ai đó

examples: The squash player killed the ball with a nick.
The sauce would kill the taste of the herbs.
Too much garlic killed the taste of the meat.
Cancer kills thousands of people every year.
The outstanding finale killed the audience.
words.defineEn: to end the life of someone or something
words.defineVi: để kết thúc cuộc sống của một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: That DJ's voice really sets my teeth on edge.
The surgeon set her broken arm.
The scheme sets a precedent for other companies.
International companies set the price of oil.
His time in the 25-meter freestyle set a national record.
words.defineEn: to prepare something in a way that is ready or suitable for use
words.defineVi: để chuẩn bị một cái gì đó trong một cách đã sẵn sàng hoặc phù hợp để sử dụng

examples: We packed sandwiches for our picnic in the park.
His wife drove him to Regent's Park.
The children are playing outside in the park.
The children were happily playing in the park.
He walked toward the park.
words.defineEn: to move a car, bus, etc. into an empty place and leave it there for a short time
words.defineVi: để di chuyển một chiếc ô tô, xe buýt, vv vào một nơi trống rỗng và để nó ở đó trong một thời gian ngắn
